name: Laurel County Board of Education
description: The Laurel County Board of Education oversees the Laurel County Public School system, established in 1840, serving students across Laurel County, Kentucky. The board consists of five elected members who govern the school district's mission to prepare students for success by providing quality education. The district serves multiple elementary, middle, and high schools with comprehensive educational programs including special education, career and technical education, and various extracurricular activities. The board meets regularly to make policy decisions and oversee district operations.
source: Verified from official website and board information
notes: Board meetings are held regularly and are open to the public. Live streaming available. Current board members: Tony Krahenbuhl, Mike Garland, Brice Hicks, Jeff Lewis, Kevin Murray. Superintendent: Denise M. Griebel. The district serves approximately 15,000 students across 20+ schools.
